item.title: Visualize continuing fractions with Julia
item.description: Calculating continuing fractions function drec(a::Function, b::Function, n0, n1, s::Int64, e::Int64, z) for i = s:e (n0, n1) = (n1, b(i, z) .* n1 .+ a(i, z) .* n0) end return n1 end ## drec (generic function with 1 method) function contfrac(a::Function, b::Function, num::Int64, z) n0 = a(0, z) n1 = b(1, z) .* n0 .+ a(1, z) d1 = b(1, z) d2 = b(2, z) .* d1 .+ a(2, z) return drec(a, b, n0, n1, 2, num, z) .

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. \[\frac{\sqrt{x_1^2 + x_2^2} - 1}{\oint f\cdot \mathbf{dr}}\] You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.
